commits.message: Fix linter error caused by inline styles

issue.title: Allow custom names for users (machines)
issue.body:
Hi, 
I plan to use Sharedrop for realtime team collaboration; but when more than 3 or 4 computers on the same room, it starts to be hard to remember "who is who", ie who is "Romantic Piglet" again ? Is this Paul ? Or Linus ? 

It would be great to be able to define custom names

comment.body:
Hey! It's been requested a few times already. I have some concerns that in specific use cases people could impersonate others. However, I understand that in other use cases, like yours, it would be useful.

The logic to implement it is relatively simple, the biggest issue is actually UI. When I have some free time, I'll see if it's possible to reuse the existing dialog box component for it - this way the UI could be the same for desktop and mobile.

Also, PRs are welcome :)

commits.message: Add light version of sharedrop svg

issue.title: [tell me] how does this compare to snapdrop.io?
[tell me] how does this compare to snapdrop.io?

comment.body:
> are they twins?

Almost ;) sharedrop.io was released in early 2014, a bit before snapdrop.io (late 2015?).

Besides smaller differences (UI, PWA, etc.) the main differences are:
- snapdrop.io uses web sockets as a fallback when direct p2p connection can't be established; this can be perceived as an advantage (and most likely is by most people), as it works in more cases than sharedrop.io, but also as a disadvantage, as transferred files are moved through a third-party server; I don't know if/how they are encrypted in such case
- sharedrop.io allows one to share files between networks via custom room names

issue.title: How to diagnose the error occurs?
issue.body:
I got an error message: "It was not possible to establish direct connection with the other peer" 
when trying to transfer files between two devices on two different networks, although the two devices "see each other".

Is there any way to diagnose the error, find the cause?

comment.body:
Hi! It's best to check for an error in browser's devtools (here are instructions for [Chrome](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/console/reference/#panel)).

However, if it doesn't work then it most likely won't be possible to establish a direct connection :/ The "devices seeing each other" feature is provided by Firebase, so it's unrelated to p2p connection that's used to transfer files.

Are both devices in the same local network or are you trying to transfer files between devices in different networks?

issue.title: Is there a file size limit?
issue.body:
I'm trying to send an 8GB file. After selecting the file nothing happens, no error, no progress. The other side doesn't see anything either.

Thanks!

comment.body:
Hi @vincentpricex!

In theory there's a limit imposed by browsers when it comes to storing temporary data locally in the filsystem. Sharedrop uses an old and deprecated Chrome-only [FileSystem API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/requestFileSystem) with fallback to IndexedDB for other browser.  Unfortunately, I did not implement a check for available space before you start sending a file. Actually, I'm quite surprised that you were able to transfer 3GB file! :) 

One solution would be to add this check, so that you would get a message about insufficient space before it starts transferring the file. Another solution could be to switch to a more modern filesystem API (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File_and_Directory_Entries_API), but I didn't have time to look into it, so I don't know what constraints and limits it has.

BTW. Did you have to change anything to be able to run it locally in a Docker container? Did you have any problems with setting up Firebase account? I remember a few people saying that it doesn't work out of the box, so providing specific instructions on how to set it up would be useful to many.
